item.title: The Two Generals Problem
item.description: :ID: e9403288-b149-474c-928f-02e52e7cf78a The Two Generals’ Problem is a classic unsolvable problem in Distributed Systems, first formulated by (Akkoyunlu, Ekanadham, and Huber 1975) and later described by . References Akkoyunlu, Eralp A, Kattamuri Ekanadham, and Richard V Huber. 1975. “Some Constraints and Tradeoffs in the Design of Network Communications.” In Proceedings of the Fifth Acm Symposium on Operating Systems Principles, 67–74.
